meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - It's that time again! I'm back with another review of the most epic kind - this time, it's all about Men of War II!

Let me tell you, fellow gamers, I went into this game with high hopes. After all, who doesn't love a good ol' fashioned World War II RTS? And let me tell you, Men of War II does not disappoint! But, before I dive into the juicy details, let's get this out of the way: I'm gonna be making fun of some critics (no hard feelings, guys!). After all, someone's gotta bring a little humor to this review game!

Now, where was I? Ah yes, Men of War II! So, what did our critic friends have to say about it?

SpazioGames gave it 77/100 and said it had "incredible deep gameplay," but also some UI issues. Yeah, no kidding! When you're in the middle of a battle, the last thing you want is some annoying pop-up menu getting in your way!

COGconnected scored it 78/100 and praised its depth and complexity. They even called it a "worthy sequel" for fans of the original! I mean, if you liked Men of War 1, you'll love this one - just be prepared to invest some time into mastering those systems!

PC Gamer gave it 74/100 and said it's a "flawed but rewarding gem" for masochistic RTS fans. Yeah, that's me! I'm that guy who loves torturing himself with ridiculously difficult games (don't worry, I won't tell anyone you're reading this).

GameSpew scored it 70/100 and mentioned the always-online requirement wasn't their thing. Okay, okay, I get it - online gaming can be a real pain sometimes! But hey, at least it's not as bad as trying to play an old game on a new console (speaking from experience here!).

IGN Italia gave it 80/100 and called it "astoundingly deep." They even mentioned some frustrating details kept it from being one of the best. Yeah, no kidding! When you're having that much fun, it's almost like they want to keep you from getting too comfortable!

And finally, CGMagazine scored it 65/100 and said Men of War II stuck too closely to its nostalgic roots. Ouch! That hurts, guys - I mean, what's wrong with a little nostalgia?

Now, back to my review (finally!). Men of War II is all about strategy, folks! You've got your unit management, resource gathering, base-building... it's like playing a real-life game of Risk (minus the risk of losing your entire collection to an overzealous aunt).

But don't get me wrong - it's not just about throwing units at each other and hoping for the best. No way! You've got to think about supply lines, flanking maneuvers, and... well, actual war strategies!

And let's not forget about multiplayer! Oh boy, it gets crazy in there! (I wish I had more time to sink into those massive matches). Sure, single-player can be fun too - but where's the real challenge?

In conclusion, Men of War II is a blast (pun intended)! With its depth, complexity, and realistic gameplay, it's the perfect game for anyone who loves World War II or just wants to test their strategic mettle. And hey, even if you don't love it as much as I do, it's still a solid choice!

Hippo Penny - out!
